column4: Hi, I have a ~/path/script.sh file and I would like to be able to call it like script.sh from wherever I am (like nano, mysq, gedit, etc). How can I do it?
edit ~/.bashrc = > export PATH=$PATH:/path/to/script              or `sudo cp script.sh /usr/local/bin`
Thank you! I'm going to try that.
Learn environ variables . type in bash `echo $PATH` -- this is the way nano gedit and othrs
